com.googlecode.biscotti.collect

Class LRUBoundedMap<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<K,V>
        • java.util.LinkedHashMap<K,V>
          • com.googlecode.biscotti.collect.LRUBoundedMap<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of keys maintained by this map
    V - the type of mapped values
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    BoundedMap<K,V>, Serializable, Cloneable, Map<K,V>

    public final class LRUBoundedMap<K,V>
extends LinkedHashMap<K,V>
implements BoundedMap<K,V>
    A LinkedHashMap implementation of BoundedMap which removes stale mappings in least-recently-accessed order.

    This implementation is not thread-safe. If multiple threads modify this map concurrently it must be synchronized externally.

    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov
    See Also:
    FIFOBoundedMap, Serialized Form

      • put

        public V put(K key,
    V value)
        Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map, removing the least-recently-accessed entry as necessary to prevent this map from overflowing. If the map previously contained a mapping for the key, the old value is replaced by the specified value.
        Specified by:
        put in interface BoundedMap<K,V>
        Specified by:
        put in interface Map<K,V>
        Overrides:
        put in class HashMap<K,V>
        Parameters:
        key - key with which the specified value is to be associated
        value - value to be associated with the specified key
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with key, or null if there was no mapping for key. (A null return can also indicate that the map previously associated null with key.)
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if the class of the specified key or value prevents it from being stored in this map
        IllegalArgumentException - if some property of the specified key or value prevents it from being stored in this map

      • offer

        public boolean offer(K key,
            V value)
        Associates the specified value with the specified key in this map, removing the least-recently-accessed entry as necessary to prevent this map from overflowing. If the map previously contained a mapping for the key, the old value is replaced by the specified value.

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • putAll

        public void putAll(Map<? extends K,? extends V> m)
        Copies all of the mappings from the specified map to this map, removing stale entries (according to their access order) as necessary to prevent the map from overflowing. The effect of this call is equivalent to that of calling put(K, V) on this map once for each mapping in the specified map.
        Specified by:
        putAll in interface BoundedMap<K,V>
        Specified by:
        putAll in interface Map<K,V>
        Overrides:
        putAll in class HashMap<K,V>
        Parameters:
        m - mappings to be stored in this map
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if the class of a key or value in the specified map prevents it from being stored in this map
        IllegalArgumentException - if some property of a key or value in the specified map prevents it from being stored in this map
